intro: Cedrota longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf cedrota, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several small, hard seeds. Cedrota longifolia is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
